newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Volvo up after H1 result.
newsitem.headline: Volvo up after H1 result.

text.p: Shares in Swedish automotive company Volvo jumped five crowns to 209 crowns within an hour of the Stockholm open after the company announced a sharp increase in first half profits.

Brokers were mixed on Volvo's profit after financial items of 7.95 billion crowns for the first six months, which compared with 3.86 billion crowns in the 1996 period. The profit was boosted by 3.25 billion crowns in divestments and 1.0 billion crowns in positive currency effects.
Most felt the result was largely neutral, some pointing to strong car sales while others pointed out second quarter losses for the trucks division in the crucial U.S. market.
